GGMncv 2.0.1
  • Reference

Constrained Precision Matrix

Source: R/htf.R
constrained.Rd

Compute the maximum likelihood estimate, given certain elements are constrained to zero (e.g., an adjacency matrix). This approach is described in Hastie et al. (2015) .

constrained(Sigma, adj)

Arguments

Sigma

Covariance matrix
adj

Matrix with contraints. A zero indicates that element should be constrained to zero.

Value

A list containing the inverse covariance matrix and the covariance matrix.

Note

The algorithm is written in c++.

Examples

# \donttest{
# data
Y <- GGMncv::ptsd[,1:5]

# columns
p <- ncol(Y)

# contstraint matrix
constraints <- matrix(0,p,p)

# set one value to zero
constraints[2,3] <- 1
constraints[3,2] <-1

# estimate, given constraints
fit <- constrained(cor(Y), adj = constraints)
Theta <- fit$Theta
# }
